fields.description:
Spectacular seaside location right on the beachfront at Holmpatrick in Skerries. Step out your door straight on to the beach for your daily swim or wait till low tide and walk across to Shenick Island. Or take a short stroll to all the super amenities of Skerries town centre.

The vast array of amenities in Skerries, one of the top places to live in the Dublin area, are all within a few minutes walk. These include the buzzing town centre shops, cafes and restaurants, beaches, park, sports and school facilities,

Accommodation

Entrance Hall; 2.38m x 2.2m Tiled with stained glass doors Main Hall: 8.57m x 2.1m Tiled; stained glass double doors; window; high ceiling 3.16m with original ceiling cornices; elegant stairs with moulded newel posts

Sitting Room: 4.38m x 6.15m Large bay window 2.37m x 1.75m, beautiful sea views to the front overlooking Skerries South Strand and islands; antique marble fireplace; High ceiling 2.16m with original ceiling cornices and centre rose; dado rail; radiator cabinet; carpet to floor

Dining Room: 6.2m x 4.38m Two large west facing windows; marble fireplace; T & G floor; high ceiling with original cornices and center rose; radiator cabinets Guest. 2.4m x .87m; W.C.; W.H.B. Shower; tiled floor Living room/Kitchen Living room area: 4.8m x 4m - Tiled floor; Sliding patio doors to rear garden; south facing window; coving Kitchen: 4.27m x 3.9m - AGA set in brick surround; Belfast sink with granite splashback ;

Fitted kitchen units with granite worktop; integrated dishwasher; recessed lighting; coving; 2 x south facing windows; tiled floor;

Utility Room: 1.85m x 4.17m Very well fitted; Tiled floor; plumbed for washing machine; sink;door to rear garden First Floor:

Bedrooms numbered per floor plan in brackets Main Bedroom (4): Front - 4.6m x 5.2m + bay window Beautiful sea views over looking Skerries South Strand and islands; high ceiling with coving; carpet. En-suite: bath; bath screen;w.c.; w.h.b.;

Tiled floor Front Bedroom (3): - 4.8m x 3.18m Dual aspect to east and south with views over Skerries South Strand and islands; high ceiling with coving; carpet;

En suite Rear Bedroom (5): 3.3m x 4.5m South facing window; high ceiling Dressing room/Study (6): 2.76m x 4.5m Rear half landing passage with w.c. and shower room Back Bedroom (2): 4.2m x 4.5m Dual aspect to west and south; timber floor; En-suite Back

Bedroom (1): 2.79m x 4.7m Dual aspect South and West; timber floor; En-suite with tiled floor; w.c. w.h.b. Outside: Long front garden with well kept lawn & pedestrian gate for beach access; overlooking beach; walled on three sides with stone wall to front; ornate stone pathway leading to front door Back Garden:

West facing rear garden; old stone walls; patio area; private back lane with pedestrian access to rear garden.

Note: These details are given in for guidance purposes only and are issued strictly on the understanding that they do not form part of any contract. Intending purchasers should satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to their accuracy and the availability of any property. No person in the employment of Kelly & Co has any authority to make or give any representation or warranty in relation to any property. Maps, drawings & photos are for identification or illustrative purposes only. Licence No: 001402.

Property Features

  • Magnificent sea & island views.
  • Two very spacious, very classical, reception rooms
  • Modern very well fitted kitchen with AGA cooker, Belfast sink, granite worktops.
  • Sea and beach at front door; Town centre cafes, shops etc 5 minute walk away
  • 5 bedrooms - 4 en suite
  • Original features - fireplaces, ceiling cornices, centre roses, stairs with moulded newel posts.
  • High ceilings throughout.
  • Hardwood double glazed sash windows to front; PVC double glazed windows to rest of property

No. 6 Westwood Road enjoys a commanding location being close proximity to Finglas Village and a short drive to Glasnevin and only 10 mins from the City Centre, located on a large site in this well-established estate.

No 6 Westwood Road is a spacious three-bedroom end of terrace property with a particularly spacious front garden. New to the market this property is in excellent condition throughout, some of the special features afforded to this property are large bright living room, separate kitchen with option to extend, 3 good sized bedrooms, off street parking for two cars to the front, South west facing.

40E bus stop for Broombridge Luas (2 min walk)

- 220 bus stop (1 min walk) - Aldi & Dunnes Stores (10 min walk)

- Tesco Clearwater (20 min walk)

- Broombridge Luas & Train Station (20 min walk)

- Ashtown & Tolka Valley Parks (5 min walk)

- Easy commute to local primary & secondary schools

- Finglas Village (20min walk)

- DCU & TU Blanchardstown (10mins drive) This property must be viewed to be appreciated. Entrance hallway

- (2.73m x 4.23m) Laminate floor, smart storage under stairs, Storage Cupboard Main bathroom (1.61m x 2.53m) - w.c and w.h.b with bath with Triton T80i electric shower, tiled floor and wall (floor to ceiling) Living room - (2.73mx 1.81m) laminate flooring, feature fireplace with open fire, light fittings Kitchen / dining room - (3.1m x 2.85m)Laminate floor, tiled splash back, fitted shaker style cream kitchen, 4 ring gas hob, fitted electric oven, dishwasher, plumbed for washing machine, fridge.

Utility/ office ( 1.43m x 2.28m) laminate flooring, extra storage Master bedroom - (2.54m x 4.18m) Carpeted and fitted wardrobes, curtains included Bedroom 2 - (2.55m x 4.16m) Laminate floor & fitted wardrobes. Bedroom 3 - (2.54m x 4.18m) Carpeted & fitted wardrobes. Family Bathroom (1.61m x 2.53m) - Fully tiled floor to ceiling, whb, wc, bath with electric shower and shower door, w.c and w.h.b. Rear garden - Good sized south facing rear garden, with patio area.

Property Facilities

  • Parking
  • Gas Fired Central Heating
  • Alarm
  • Wired for Cable Television

fields.address: Highfield, Mornington Park, Malahide Road, Artane
fields.description:
Highfield is a stunning double fronted detached bungalow that has been beautifully renovated by its current owner to produce a stylish and light filled family home ready for immediate occupancy.

The property extends to approx. 118sq m and comprises of a welcoming entrance hall off which is the spacious living room, bedrooms 1 and 2 (with ensuite) and a stunning open plan kitchen/ dining/ family room. An inner hall leads to a third double bedroom and large shower room. Upstairs the attic provides another 12sq m of space and there is a fully tiled shower space with Velux window.

The front garden is set behind gates, is laid in cobblelock and provides ample off-street parking. There are mature trees and shrubbery that act as a screen to the front of the property and provide privacy from the road. The back garden to the rear is walled in and enjoys a pleasant west facing orientation.

Highfield enjoys a fantastic location conveniently situated close to all local amenities including local shops, restaurants and cafes. Sporting enthusiasts are spoiled for choice with numerous facilities in the area having access to a generous array of clubs including tennis, rugby, cricket, Gaelic, sailing, Westwood Gym as well as golf at Clontarf Golf Club, Royal Dublin Golf Club and St Anne s Golf Club. The area has excellent transport links close by including numerous bus routes and Killester and Clontarf DART Stations which are just a short drive away and provide swift access to the city centre and beyond. East Point Business Park, Beaumont Hospital, M1, M50 and Dublin Airport are all within easy access.

Entrance Hall 4.85m x 1.40m. Welcoming bright and spacious entrance hall with wood flooring.

Living Room 3.65m x 3.65m. With wood flooring, bay window, feature cast iron fireplace with marble surround, ceiling cornice and rose.

Kitchen/ Family Room 5.75m x 4.55m. Stunning open plan room with wood flooring, wall and floor units, integrated appliances, recessed lighting, large skylight, two double French doors leading to west facing rear garden.

Dining Area 3.46m x 2.45m. Part of open plan kitchen with wood flooring.

Bedroom 1 3.60m x 3.60m. Double bedroom to the front of the property with carpet flooring, bay window, ceiling cornice and rose.

Bedroom 2 3.96m x 3.12m. Spacious bedroom to the rear of the property with carpet flooring, built in wardrobes and ceiling rose.

Ensuite 2.58m x 1.60m. Fully tiled ensuite with wc, whb over cabinet, large shower with rainforest shower head, heated towel rail, recessed lighting and cornice

Inner Hall 4.50m x 0.90m. With wood flooring, ceiling cornice, recessed lighting, shelving and shelved hotpress.

Bedroom 3 4.50m x 2.15m. Spacious double bedroom to the front of the property with carpet flooring and bay window.

Shower Room 2.40m x 2.00m. Fully tiled with wc, whb over cabinet, LED backlit mirror, electric shower, extractor fan and skylight. Attic 4.60m x 3.80m.

Large space with carpet flooring, eaves storage and Velux window. Shower Space 3.60m x 1.25m. Fully tiled with wc, whb, shower, heated towel rail and Velux window..

Property Features

  • Three bedroom detached bungalow
  • Stunning open plan kitchen/ dining/ family room
  • Three spacious double bedrooms
  • Converted attic with shower space
  • West facing back garden
  • Ample off-street parking
  • Gas fired central heating
  • Excellent location close to abundance of amenities

*** SUPER LOCATION / OFF STREET PARKING / ATTIC CONVERSION/ DOUBLE STORY EXTENSION***

This extended three bedroom residence is located in the very popular and sought after location of East Wall in a quiet cul-de-sac off the main road. No.30 is very well presented and no stone has been left unturned in terms of renovations. Boasting generously proportioned accommodation throughout, this property has a well-designed floor plan and a great sense of space that has been extended to the front and rear and also benefits from a double story extension, along with an attic conversion. Bargy Road will appeal to those looking to move straight in and just unpack.

On entering, there is a paved gated driveway offering off street parking. There is an extended porch adding to the space in the hall. Off the welcoming hallway to the left is a tastefully decorated and very large living space. The living space is much larger than the norm and really is a fantastic hub for the whole family to gather. There are also two storage rooms in this space to cater for all your storage needs.

The kitchen to the rear has cream gloss presses and ample worktop space for all your cooking needs. The kitchen features patio doors that lead out to a low maintenance rear garden. Off the kitchen is a utility /lobby space that leads into a fully tiled bathroom.

Upstairs the generous landing leads to 3 double bedrooms. The two bedrooms to the rear have been extended giving ample space. The master bedroom to the front benefits from a fully tiled en-suite.

Finally completing the internal accommodation, the attic has been converted into a great light-filled space and is accessed via a Stira.

East Wall is a vibrant and active neighbourhood on the doorstep of the City Centre whilst still absorbing a quaint village feel and a most warming community spirit. The Sean O'Casey Centre is a great addition to the area offering a private gym, a community cré¨che and a wide range of events. There is a choice of supermarkets nearby with Aldi and Lidl on your doorstep. East Point Business Park, Fairview and Clontarf seafront are also within a 10 minute walk and Dublin City Centre and Docklands are a leisurely 1KM distance away. Public transport is in abundance with the area well catered for by Dublin Bus, LUAS, DART and Dublin Bikes.

This is a fantastic opportunity to acquire an extended 3 bedroom residence with the advantage of an attic conversion in the area where no work is required and the simple muted tones and layout should appeal to all that view. No.30 Bargy Road is a real winner in terms of location and as a spacious well-proportioned home.

Features Paved gated driveway offering off street parking

Extended porch 2014

Front windows 2011 Double story extension

2012 Converted Attic accessed via stira

2014 Extra large living room

Extended kitchen, utility room & bathroom approx 2000 New kitchen presses 2018

Rooms Porch - 2.2m x 1.2m Extended in 2014 Features laminate flooring Reception Room 1 - 6.45m x 3.26m Very large space and has the same laminate flooring as the hall and kitchen Kitchen - 3.64m x 2.77m Extended and features presses that were put on in 2018 Overlooks the low maintenance garden accessed via patio doors Same laminate as hall and living room

Utility Room - 1.25m x 0.76m

Fully tiled Bathroom - 1.98m x 1.75m Fully tiled and features window Gravity fed T Bar shower Bedroom 1 - 3.34m x 3.33m Master carpeted bedroom that features en-suite

Ensuite - 1.44m x 0.87m Fully tiled Triton T90 electric shower

Bedroom 2 - 5.23m x 2.09m Laminate flooring and extended

Bedroom 3 - 5.23m x 2.09m Laminate flooring and extended Attic - 4.11m x 3.03m great light filled space that is accessed via stira Viewing Details ***Due to COVID 19 restrictions, in person viewings are currently on hold***

Superb 3 bedroom detached double fronted home with private parking and a west facing garden.

This spacious double fronted property boasts separate vehicle and pedestrian access as well as a charming sand coloured brick wall surrounding the home. Upon entering you will find a large tiled entrance hall leading into the generous dual aspect living room with laminate floors, fireplace and double doors opening to the west facing paved garden. The spacious kitchen is separated from the living room by a rear hall with a storage room and a guest w.c. with a tiled floor. The kitchen itself features a checkered tiled floor and splashback tiling plus plenty of counter & cupboard space. The kitchen connects with a large dining room to the front of the home which could easily be used a home office, playroom or gym. Upstairs consists of three double bedrooms with fitted wadrobes, two of the bedrooms come with comfy carpet. The master bedroom features laminate floors and an ensuite with a tiled floor. The accommodation is completed by a storage room on the landing and a spacious family bathroom with a tiled floor.

Jamestown Avenue is ideally located a short stroll from Inchicore village and the Grand Canal. There are a host of amenities on your doorstep including bars, cafes, shops and a number of outdoor leisure facilities such as IMMA & The Memorial Gardens. The Red Line Luas is closeby making the city centre easily accessible and the M50 is five minutes away for further journeys.

Property Features

  • Year of construction 1960
  • West facing garden
  • Private parking
  • Dual aspect living room
  • Ample storage
  • Separate kitchen
  • Spacious interior
  • Fitted wardrobes
  • Turn key condition
  • Detached

Conveniently located just two miles from the city centre, Mount Pleasant Square is situated on the edge of Ranelagh Village which is well served by an abundance of amenities both social and essential including fashionable shops, bars, delicatessens and restaurants. The locality is well served by public transport with the nearest Luas station at Ranelagh Village; just a few minutes' walk from the front door. Some of the city's premier schools are located in the immediate vicinity with St Stephens Green less than 2km away or a brisk 15 minute stroll. The location simply couldn't be better.

ucked in off Ranelagh Road, No. 48 Mount Pleasant Square is an imposing, double fronted family home with instant curb appeal. The two storey over garden level property has been re-designed, refurbished and extended to provide region 2,360sqft of beautifully appointed accommodation with every conceivable modern comfort and all the Georgian period character you might expect from a property of this ilk. From the moment you step up onto the granite steps and through the hall door the instant impression is of an abundance of light and space. From here there are reception rooms either side of the entrance hallway and a view right though the kitchen cum breakfast room to the 70ft south facing rear garden. Outside there is a large sandstone patio / terrace between the main house and the lawn. Surrounded by 100 year old stone walls the garden faces directly south and offers lots of space for outdoor activities for busy children or family barbeques for the adults when the summer finally arrives.

The Living room enjoys a dual aspect with natural light pouring through from sun up to sun down. At the focal point of the room is an original fireplace & surround. The re-framed and restored sash windows, plaster detail and wooden floors complete the décor in the main reception room. This high quality finish and attention to detail is obvious throughout this substantial family home, with the open plan kitchen, dining and breakfast room adding more of a modern twist to the accommodation at hall level. There are two sets of French doors from the extended breakfast room which does a lot to connect the private and surprisingly large south facing garden to the internal living space.

Upstairs there are two very large double rooms and the main bathroom. The master bedroom has the added benefit of a walk through wardrobe and en suite bathroom which overlooks the garden. The additional bedrooms are situated at the garden level complete with a shower room. One or both of the rooms at ground floor level could be used as a den/playroom or home office which has become a must have in 2021.

Property Features

  • Stunning Location Overlooking Mount Pleasant Square & Tennis Club
  • Bright, Elegant Accommodation Extending to Approximately 220sqm/2,360sqft.
  • Large South Facing Rear Garden with Terrace
  • New Double Glazed Sash Windows Throughout
  • New Timber Flooring Throughout
  • Beautiful Period Features
  • BER Exempt
  • Security Alarm System
  • Gas Fired Central Heating

Extremely well presented four bedroom duplex apartment tucked away in a quiet courtyard in this lovely Sorohan built development. This fine property boasts 1,300sqft/120sqm of spacious accommodation comprising briefly of hallway leading off into fully fitted kitchen with dining area. Large living room with feature fireplace, doors out to large decked balcony which enjoys a wonderful outlook over the water feature and communal gardens. Upstairs are four generous bedrooms (1 ensuite) with the fourth bedroom offering the perfect opportunity to use as a home office. The large family bathroom completes the accommodation. No. 185 also benefits from a designated parking space with plenty of additional parking within the grounds of the development.

Trimbleston is one of the most highly regarded developments on the South side and is ideally located off the Goatstown Road. Easy access is afforded to every conceivable amenity to include local shops, boutiques, eateries, leisure facilities, transport links, UCD and Dundrum Town Centre. The villages of Donnybrook, Ranelagh and Donnybrook are just a short distance away as is the N11 and M50 allowing easy travel to the city centre and beyond, alongside regular bus services and the local LUAS station at Windy Arbour.

Entrance Hall Wooden floors, ceiling coving and under stairs storage. Guest WC Tiled floor with part tiled wall, wash hand basin and toilet.

Living Room Large reception room with wooden floors, ceiling coving, coal effect gas fire with natural stone surround. Doors open out onto large balcony which overlooks the water feature and communal gardens.

Kitchen/ Dining Room Tiled floor, ceiling coving. Excellent range of fitted wall and base units incorporating a sink unit and splash back. Also includes integrated Zanussi oven, hob and extractor fan, washer dryer and fridge freezer. Plumbed for a dishwasher. Recessed lighting. Bay window overlooks the inner courtyard.

Landing With attic access, ceiling coving and hot press.

Bedroom 1 Large double bedroom with wooden floors, fitted wardrobes and a large window overlooking the water feature.

Ensuite Tiled floor, part tiled walls and shower cubicle with overhead shower, wash hand basin, toilet and heated towel rail.

Bedroom 2 Double room, wooden floors, fitted wardrobes.

Bedroom 3 Generous single room with fitted wardrobes.

Bedroom 4 Large double room with fitted wardrobes, wooden floor and overlooks communal gardens. Bathroom Tiled floor with part tiled walls, toilet, wash hand basin and bath with overhead shower and inset mirror, heated towel rail

fields.address: 35, Cloonlara Square, Phoenix Park Racecourse, Castleknock
fields.description:
An outstanding 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom second floor apartment spanning c.75 sq m of luxury located in an exclusive and much sought after development at the entrance to the Phoenix Park. 35 Cloonlara Square is sure to appeal to all those looking for something very special. With its exceptionally grand surroundings complimented by such a convenient location this apartment provides the ultimate in luxury and privacy. The setting is tranquil and scenic yet it is only 6km from the city centre. With extensive outdoor areas offered by the Phoenix Park it is also only a stroll to Castleknock Village and it's ever increasing range of high-end shops, restaurants and bars. This stylish, modern and exclusive two bedroom apartment is beautifully finished and presented in turn key condition throughout. It boasts wonderful panoramic views and an extensive south facing balcony. The accommodation includes a welcoming and spacious hallway, two double bedrooms (both with built in wardrobes) with master en suite, a main bathroom, hot press and storage. There is a large and tastefully decorated living/dining area with immediate access the fitted kitchen. The Phoenix Park Racecourse, which was built in 2005 by Flynn & O' Flaherty has a wonderful mixture of apartments, duplexes and family homes. The development is within easy reach of the of the city centre. Local amenities include sport and leisure facilities, not least the beautiful Phoenix Park. Transport and travel links include the N3, M3 and M50. Both Ashtown and The Navan Road Train Stations are within 5 mins walk. ACCOMMODATION briefly comprising: Kitchen - 4.730 x 1.802 fully fitted and integrated - Living room - 4.603 x 5.524 (4.631) Bathroom - 2.031 x 2.387 whb. wc and bath Bedroom - 2.992 x 2.778 fitted wardrobes Main bedroom - 3.797 x 3.065 fitted wardrobes with en-suite - 1.302 x 2.595 Hallway - 3.296 x 1.333 Hallway 2- 1.156 x 3.902 Storage room - 1.468 x 0.589 Storage room (boiler) - 1.392 x 0.760 Kindly note these details are for guidance purposes only. Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. MANAGEMENT COMPANY: WYSE - The management fees are c.€1708

Property Features

  • Location Location Location
  • South aspect balcony from living area looking over green land
  • GFCH
  • Underground car park
  • Beautiful community with onsite shopping facilities
  • Close to all transportation & m50

This one bedroom second floor apartment is located in a sought after development of Millbank, the links, located on Station Road in Portmarnock. The property itself is in good condition. The apartment overlooks beautiful landscaped open space. There is a frequent bus service to the front and a frequent DART and rail station close by. The estate is located close to Dublin Airport and a feat minutes to the M50/Port tunnel.

 

Accommodation comprises of entrance hall, hot press and storage area off, double bedroom, kitchen, lounge/dining room with south westerly balcony off.

Entrance hall Hot press off storage room off, ceiling coving Bathroom Wc, whb, bath tiled surround, tiled floor, wall shower attachment Bedroom 1 Tv point, built in wardrobes Kitchen Wall & floor mounted units, tiled between, oven, hob, extractor fan, integrated dish washer, plumbed for dishwasher, tiled floor in kitchen area Open Plan Living/Dining room patio door to south westerly facing garden terrace, fully fenced

fields.address: 29 The Pavilion, Marine Road,  Dun Laoghaire
fields.description:
Situated in this highly regarded development of generously appointed seafront apartments, No.29 exudes a great sense of space as soon as you cross its threshold and enjoys a magnificent sea view from its living room and balcony.

he current owners have been superb caretakers of this residence, which has been immaculately maintained throughout. Extending to approximately 84sq.m. it comprises an entrance hall with hot-press and large storage closet, spacious living/dining with floor to ceiling windows incorporating doors out to a large balcony with direct sea views, filling the room with an abundance of light. The kitchen is a separate room with extensive built in units and there are two double bedrooms to the rear of the apartment, the main of which has a large en-suite and access to a sunny south facing balcony. The accommodation is completed by a shower room and the appeal of the apartment is further enhanced by its secure designated parking space.

The location is second to none with the property being within striking distance of all Dun Laoghaire has to offer including shopping centres, restaurants, bars and excellent transport links including the DART and QBC to the city centre. Other nearby attractions include the harbour, yacht clubs, marine leisure facilities, weekend farmers market at People s Park and coastal walks. The charming villages of Monkstown, Sandycove, Glasthule and Dalkey are all within close proximity.

Entrance Hall With wooden floor, recessed lighting, radiator covers, large storeroom and hot-press

Kitchen With tiled floor and tiled splash back, fitted floor and wall units, integrated oven/hobs, plumbing for washing machine, plumbing for dishwasher, provision for fridge/freezer, stainless-steel sink with drainer and open breakfast bar to living room. Living/ Dining Room Large bright room with wooden floor, floor to ceiling windows, feature fireplace with wooden surround, radiator covers and doors to spacious balcony with sea views. Bedroom 1 Large double bedroom with ample fitted wardrobes, TV points and doors to the decked south facing balcony En-Suite Large room with tiled floor, part tiled walls, extractor fan, shower, bath, wash hand basin and w.c. Bedroom 2 Double bedroom with fitted wardrobes

Shower Room With tiled floor, wall mounted mirror, extractor fan, shaving point, shower, wash hand basin and w.c.

Property Features

  • Stunning direct Sea views
  • Two-bedroom 3rd floor apartment
  • Tastefully presented throughout
  • Lift access
  • Ample storage
  • Two balconies
  • Designated parking
  • Electric gates
  • Beautiful coastal location
  • Excellent transport links
